name: Heart Failure - Classification and Diagnostic Criteria
content:
HEART FAILURE (HF) - CLINICAL SYNDROME:

DEFINITION:
- Inability of heart to pump sufficient blood to meet metabolic demands
- Structural or functional cardiac abnormality

CLASSIFICATION BY EJECTION FRACTION:
- HFrEF: LVEF ≤40% (reduced EF, systolic dysfunction)
- HFmrEF: LVEF 41-49% (mildly reduced EF)
- HFpEF: LVEF ≥50% (preserved EF, diastolic dysfunction)

CLASSIFICATION BY TIMING:
- Acute: New onset or decompensation of chronic HF
- Chronic: Stable symptoms
- Acute-on-chronic: Decompensation of known chronic HF

NYHA FUNCTIONAL CLASS:
- Class I: No limitation, asymptomatic
- Class II: Slight limitation, comfortable at rest
- Class III: Marked limitation, comfortable only at rest
- Class IV: Symptoms at rest, inability to carry out any activity

DIAGNOSTIC CRITERIA (Framingham):
Major: PND, neck vein distention, rales, cardiomegaly, acute pulmonary edema, S3 gallop, JVP >16cm, hepatojugular reflux
Minor: Ankle edema, night cough, dyspnea on exertion, hepatomegaly, pleural effusion, tachycardia ≥120
Requires: 2 major OR 1 major + 2 minor

BIOMARKERS:
- BNP >100 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >125 pg/mL (suggests HF)
- Higher levels indicate worse prognosis

ECHOCARDIOGRAPHY (Essential):
- Assess LVEF, wall motion, valve function, chamber sizes

TREATMENT (HFrEF):
- Guideline-directed medical therapy (GDMT):
  1. ACE-I/ARB or ARNI (sacubitril/valsartan)
  2. Beta-blocker (carvedilol, metoprolol succinate, bisoprolol)
  3. Mineralocorticoid receptor antagonist (spironolactone/eplerenone)
  4. SGLT2 inhibitor (dapagliflozin, empagliflozin)
- Diuretics for volume overload
- Consider: ICD, CRT, cardiac transplant
